functionality

Class Date

  • java.lang.Object
    • functionality.Date
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Date is the class that handles time-related operations.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kenneth Jensen, Florin Bordei, Teakosheen Joulak, Jimmi Børgesen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Date

        public Date(int day,
            int month,
            int year)
        This is the class constructor.
        Parameters:
        day - day of the month.
        month - month of the year, ranging from 1-12.
        year - the year in the gregorian calendar.

      • isLeapYear

        public boolean isLeapYear(int year)
        Method to check, whether the year is a leap year.
        Parameters:
        year - the year the method is to check.The usual use case is to pass the Dates year to this method.
        Returns:
        A boolean denoting whether or not the year is a leap year.

        Returns:
